newsitem.title: JAPAN: MOF may file criminal complaint on DKB - Jiji.
newsitem.headline: MOF may file criminal complaint on DKB - Jiji.

text.p: Japan's Ministry of Finance may file a criminal complaint with prosecutors against Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank if it is proven to have obstructed a ministry inspection, a Finance Ministry official was quoted as saying on Friday by Jiji news agency.

"The authorities may take action, or (the Finance Ministry itself) may file a complaint," a MOF official was quoted as saying. "We can't decide until we can prove they are liable, but it is certain that they are suspected of being."
He added that the complaint, if filed, would be over a violation of a law governing the inspections of banks.
DKB said earlier it was possible that there was a cover-up of its questionable loans to corporate racketeers during a MOF inspection.
